calling itself "America's President Bush Committee" has been established, seeking to draft one particular individual to run to be America's President Bush -- Rep. Mike Pence ( R-IN). The Daily Caller reports: The effort is coordinated by Ralph Banko, who worked as a deputy counsel in the Reagan Administration and in President Bush 's Office of Faith-based a Community Initiatives. " Mike Pence describes himself as "First a Christian, then a conservative, then a Republican." He unifies fiscal, social, and national security conservatives, and will energize the conservative coalition essential to wining back the White House in 2012, said Benko in a press release." mixed signals about whether Mike Pence will run for president. American Idol's season-one co-host Brian Dunkleman admits to having been extremely freaked out the first time he saw Simon Cowell tell someone they should never sing again. It's one thing to watch it on television, but then you spend time with these kids and you have to look at them right in the eyes, and then their mother is looking at you, like, "What just happened?'? that: "Otherwise there is a risk the subject may be devalued." The review warns that there is a danger schools will sideline music if it is not central to the curriculum. Without the obligation for music lessons to be a part of the school curriculum, there is a very real concern that the subject might well wither away in many schools- and in the worst case scenario, could all but disappear in others.
